lines.text: Enter SOMERSET, with his army a Captain of TALBOTs with him

lines.speaker: somerset
lines.text: It is too late I cannot send them now: This expedition was by York and Talbot Too rashly plotted: all our general force Might with a sally of the very town Be buckled with: the overdaring Talbot Hath sullied all his gloss of former honour By this unheedful, desperate, wild adventure: York set him on to fight and die in shame, That, Talbot dead, great York might bear the name.

lines.speaker: captain
lines.text: Here is Sir William Lucy, who with me Set from our oermatchd forces forth for aid.

lines.speaker: somerset
lines.text: How now, Sir William! whither were you sent

lines.speaker: lucy
lines.text: Whither, my lord from bought and sold Lord Talbot Who, ringd about with bold adversity, Cries out for noble York and Somerset, To beat assailing death from his weak legions: And whiles the honourable captain there Drops bloody sweat from his warwearied limbs, And, in advantage lingering, looks for rescue, You, his false hopes, the trust of Englands honour, Keep off aloof with worthless emulation. Let not your private discord keep away The levied succors that should lend him aid, While he, renowned noble gentleman, Yields up his life unto a world of odds: Orleans the Bastard, Charles, Burgundy, Alencon, Reignier, compass him about, And Talbot perisheth by your default.

lines.speaker: somerset
lines.text: York set him on York should have sent him aid.

lines.speaker: lucy
lines.text: And York as fast upon your grace exclaims Swearing that you withhold his levied host, Collected for this expedition.

lines.speaker: somerset
lines.text: York lies he might have sent and had the horse I owe him little duty, and less love And take foul scorn to fawn on him by sending.

lines.speaker: lucy
lines.text: The fraud of England, not the force of France, Hath now entrappd the nobleminded Talbot: Never to England shall he bear his life But dies, betrayd to fortune by your strife.

lines.speaker: somerset
lines.text: Come, go I will dispatch the horsemen straight: Within six hours they will be at his aid.

lines.speaker: lucy
lines.text: Too late comes rescue: he is taen or slain For fly he could not, if he would have fled And fly would Talbot never, though he might.

lines.speaker: somerset
lines.text: If he be dead, brave Talbot, then adieu!

lines.speaker: lucy
lines.text: His fame lives in the world, his shame in you.
